summary: Kills motion process and attempts to capture video from webcam using ffmpeg, then starts motion with the mconfig.conf configuration file. Not suitable for media file processing.

details.comment: Kills motion process and attempts to capture video from webcam using ffmpeg, then starts motion with the mconfig.conf configuration file. Not suitable for media file processing.
details.content:
killall -s KILL motion
# ffmpeg -re -i ../../samples/video/LlfeL29BP.mp4 -f v4l2 /dev/video0 &
motion -c mconfig.conf
# to conclude, this is only useful for webcams, not for media file processing.
